file_content.text: Morale's through the roof since you delivered the goods to Captain Kanen.
Captain Kanen's waiting for those supplies. Make the Empire proud!
You are truly a beacon of hope to the Empire, my lord.
You strike quite the pose, agent. The figure of Imperial dominance if I've ever seen it.
That steely confidence, charming grit and relentless determination. For a mercenary, you're truly a model of the Imperial spirit.
What resolve. Not a shiver, and your eyes ablaze with... confidence.
Look at you. Fellowship, fighting togeth--no... ah: "Melting Hoth with the flames of Imperial camaraderie!"
One glance at your impressive stature, and our men will know that we've nearly won Hoth.
My business on Hoth is far more vital than motivating your troops, officer.
I'm not here for inspiration.
Of course, my lord. But please, consider the benefits.
If your men are going to respect me, let it be out of terror.
I'd prefer they fear me.
I'm sure they quiver at your mention. But there's still room to increase their awe.
I wouldn't be surprised if Hoth's taking its toll on the military's resolve.
Is their motivation lacking?
Conditions are admittedly unfavorable, agent.
I can spot a sales pitch from ten kilometers. What's your angle?
Cut the praise.
All right, hunter. I'll level with you.
How is the Empire faring?
Our recovery proceeds wonderfully, with only the minor problem of morale.
Cut the adulation.
I hope this is worth my time.
I promise you, hunter, it most certainly is.
On top of pirates and the Republic, our boys battle subzero temperatures, blizzards, frostbite... the list goes on. But you can boost their morale!
What better way to warm up and invigorate the men than by rescuing supplies from the ship graveyard?
Anything to boost morale.
You're truly an inspiration.
Heroes don't come cheap.
I believe our propaganda fund could provide a proper allowance.
I can think of a few more entertaining ways to keep warm, officer.
[Flirt] I know alternatives.
I... well... who turned up the thermal arrays? Duty first, Ferrig, duty first.
There's nothing like a strong drink to put fire in a man's spirit.
I know how to invigorate them.
Regrettably, our funds don't allow for such indulgences.
Good pitch, but I don't care.
Surely you care for the Empire's dominance on Hoth. For our dominion over the galaxy.
How about it? Recover the supplies from the shipyard? Emerge a legend of the Empire?
Since you put it that way.
What do you say, hunter? Recover supplies from the ship graveyard? Come out a hero, and a bit richer to boot?
Richer? Now you're talking.
Excellent. But let's keep payment talk quiet. Better for our boys to see this as a selfless act of heroism.
If you insist, officer.
Simply beat our competitors to the ship graveyard, liberate valuables from the wreckage and deliver them to Captain Kanen. Then we'll have more than enough provisions to weather the storm!
I think not. [Refuse quest]
The men will be crushed, crushed by this news.
Forget the blizzard! Warm your hands by the flames of Imperial victory!
